title: Tsunami Warning Issued for Northern California
summary: The area includes Crescent City, which is particularly vulnerable because of its low elevation. The rest of the state was under a lesser tsunami advisory.

title: Even New York’s Strict Gun Laws Couldn’t Prevent the Midtown Shooting
summary: New York City has some of the toughest gun laws in the nation. But Monday’s mass shooting showed their limits, security experts said.

title: The Familiar Suicide and Final Wish of the N.Y.C. Gunman
summary: Shane Tamura is not the first former football player to shoot himself in the chest and request that his brain be examined.

title: After Park Avenue Shooting, Anti-Muslim Disinformation Spread Rapidly
summary: Once it became clear that the only Muslim involved in the attack was one of the victims, right-wing commentators sought to shift the focus to Zohran Mamdani.

title: Senate, Rejecting Whistle-Blower Alarms, Confirms Bove to Appeals Court
summary: The Trump loyalist was narrowly approved as Republicans brushed aside concerns about his conduct as a senior Justice Department official.

title: Grassley Spurns Whistle-Blowers in Bove Confirmation Fight
summary: The senator’s treatment of whistle-blowers detailing allegations against Emil Bove, the Trump loyalist and appeals court pick, has had a chilling effect, critics say.

title: Trump Bypasses Congress to Keep Interim Prosecutors in California and Nevada
summary: A similar approach in New Jersey has led to cancellations of court proceedings, as judges question whether the president’s designee for U.S. Attorney has any authority.

title: Trump Says Epstein ‘Stole’ Underage Victim from Mar-a-Lago Spa
summary: President Trump acknowledged that Jeffrey Epstein recruited one of his victims, Virginia Giuffre, from Mar-a-Lago, and distanced himself from the allegations: “By the way, she had no complaints about us.”

title: Booker Accuses Democrats of Being ‘Complicit’ With Trump in Heated Exchange
summary: When a pair of Democrats sought to win quick approval of a bipartisan package of policing legislation, a third rose to object, saying the party must take every opportunity to challenge President Trump.

title: Top F.D.A. Official Resigns Under Pressure
summary: After turning down several new drugs and restricting use of another, Dr. Vinay Prasad drew the ire of the right-wing influencer Laura Loomer and others.

title: How a Chinese Brand Reshaped Hong Kong’s Food Delivery Scene
summary: Meituan, the Chinese food delivery giant, tested its global expansion in Hong Kong, where its Keeta service displaced a rival before moving to other markets.

title: Thailand and Cambodia Stepped Back From War, but Their Temple Fight Remains
summary: Intense nationalism and disputed history — and maps — stoke the neighbors’ hostilities. Even a surge of international diplomacy has brought little hope of a lasting peace.

title: What to Know About the Thailand-Cambodia Clash
summary: The two Southeast Asian countries signed a cease-fire agreement on Monday after days of fighting that killed at least 38 people.

title: Trump Admits Financial Penalties on Russia ‘May or May Not’ Work
summary: President Trump’s threats have raised questions about how much leverage the United States has left with Moscow.

title: Trump Says Gaza Will Get More Aid, but Israel Will Distribute It
summary: The president has in recent days acknowledged there is “starvation” in Gaza, a break with Israeli officials who have faced deep criticism over the humanitarian crisis there.

title: What Would Recognizing a Palestinian State Mean?
summary: The announcements reflect deep frustrations with Israel’s conduct in Gaza and in the occupied West Bank, experts say.

title: Countries Scramble to Strike Trade Deals With Trump as Deadline Nears
summary: It’s a race against time for some of America’s top trading partners who are negotiating furiously to reach agreements by Aug. 1.

title: U.S. and China Fail to Reach Immediate Deal to Prolong Trade Truce
summary: After a “constructive” round of talks ahead of an Aug. 12 deadline, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said, “Nothing is agreed until we speak with President Trump.”

title: Restaurant Review: Taquería Frontera in Los Angeles
summary: At Taquería Frontera, the art of Tijuana-style tacos is on full display.

title: Israel Destroyed Gaza’s Health System. Palestinians Will Die for Years to Come.
summary: Many in Gaza will not survive, not because of their injuries alone but because of the lack of a health care system to treat them.

title: The Trump Presidency Takes a Better Turn
summary: If Trump’s opponents want to be effective, we have to come to grips with realities that have so far eluded us.

title: Reno Shooting Shatters Lives at a Bachelor Party
summary: The police said that a gunman had shot randomly at a group that was preparing to head home to California after a bachelor party weekend. Three people died in the shooting, and three others were injured.

title: Novo Nordisk, Ozempic Drugmaker, Sees Stock Plunge 20% After Profit Warning
summary: Novo Nordisk slashed its financial forecasts as it struggled to fight off competition in the United States. It also named a new chief executive, who highlighted the “urgency” of the moment.

title: Katy Perry and Justin Trudeau Get a Table for 2, Inviting a Serving of Speculation
summary: The former Canadian prime minister had dinner on Monday night with the newly single American pop star in Montreal, spurring intrigue over how they ended up meeting.

title: University of California Settles With Jewish Students Over U.C.L.A. Protests
summary: Jewish students and a professor said the university had allowed a hostile protest. After the settlement was announced, the Department of Justice separately said it had found the university violated civil rights laws.
